headline: Sheena Monnin, Miss Pennsylvania USA 2012, Resigns After Alleged Pageant Fraud (UPDATED)
short descr: Sheena Monnin, who was crowned Miss Pennsylvania USA 2012 in December 2011, announced that she is resigning from her position
image_caption(s): Miss Rhode Island USA Olivia Culpo is crowned Miss USA 2012
article: Just as we were basking in the afterglow of this weekend's Miss USA 2012 pageant, we got this bombshell: Miss Pennsylvania USA 2012 has suddenly resigned -- and she's alleging foul play. Sheena Monnin, who was crowned Miss Pennsylvania USA 2012 in December 2011, announced that she is resigning from her position effective immediately. In a statement published on her Facebook page, Monnin states that the Miss Universe Organization, which oversees the Miss USA pageant, is "fraudulent, lacking in morals, inconsistent, and in many ways trashy," not specifying what dishonest activity she observed. About 12 hours later, Monnin released a second Facebook statement explaining what precisely inspired her abrupt resignation as Miss Pennsylvania USA 2012: I witnessed another contestant who said she saw the list of the Top 5 BEFORE THE SHOW EVER STARTED proceed to call out in order who the Top 5 were before they were announced on stage. Apparently the morning of June 3rd she saw a folder lying open to a page that said 'FINAL SHOW Telecast, June 3, 2012' and she saw the places for Top 5 already filled in. The pageant, which began with 51 contestants, was whittled down to 16 finalists after the show's opening number on Sunday evening. Then, with each portion of the competition (swimsuit, evening gowns and the interview question), the field was narrowed down to ten, then five. Olivia Culpo, Miss Rhode Island USA, was declared the winner.But Monnin's allegation is that the final five were selected before the pageant even began. Whether or not the contestant who saw the list comes forward, the 27-year-old pageant queen says, she can no longer associate herself with a "system that [...] is dishonest." If the allegation is true, it will be one of the first "rigging" scandals the Miss USA pageant has seen. Former contestants have made headlines for other improprieties, including former Miss USA Rima Fakih's DUI charges last month. We've reached out to the Miss Universe Organization for comment and will update if we hear back. In the meantime, you can read Monnin's full statements on her Facebook page.UPDATE: Turns out Monnin might have resigned for another reason entirely. The Miss Universe Organization told the Daily Mail, "In an email to state pageant organizers, she cited the Miss Universe Organizationsâ€™ policy regarding transgendered contestants, implemented two months ago, as the reason for her resignation." In addition, Miss Universe denies any rigging and is taking Monnin to court over her allegation. Donald Trump, who runs the organization, told "Good Morning America," "We're going to be suing her now because she made a charge and she said that it's fixed, and now it turns out that it wasn't fixed [...] she suffers from a thing called loser's remorse." Stay tuned for updates on what may turn into a messy legal battle.Check out photos from Sunday's Miss USA 2012 pageant:
